go_data.term: transforming growth factor beta-activated receptor activity
go_data.justification: TGFBR3 mediates TGF-beta superfamily ligand-dependent as well as ligand-independent signalling to both Smad and non-Smad signalling pathways.

go_data.term: negative regulation of transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway
go_data.justification: TGFBR3 is a potential negative regulator of TGF-beta signaling.
TGFBR3 is a receptor and thus located on the cell surface.
TGFBR3 knockdown enhanced the expressions of COL1A1, COL3A1 and ACTA2 in HAFs, indicating a role in fibrosis.
TGFBR3 protects cardiac fibroblasts from hypoxia-induced apoptosis.
Ang-II can stimulate NADPH oxidases 2 (Nox2) activity through the TGF-beta1 pathway.
Ang-II-induced HAFs were used as a cell model of atrial fibrosis.
Smad3 signalling has been shown to participate in cardiac fibrosis and was activated in Ang-II-treated HAFs.
Ang-II-treated HAFs were used to study the effects of Ang-II on cell proliferation and migration.
COL1A1 is a key component of collagen fibrils, which are essential for tissue structure and function.
COL1A1 is a major component of the extracellular matrix in connective tissue.
COL1A1 expression is increased in atrial fibrosis, suggesting its involvement in the fibrotic process.
COL3A1 is a component of collagen fibrils, which are involved in fibril organization.
COL3A1 is a type of collagen that is secreted into the extracellular matrix.
COL3A1 expression is increased in atrial fibrosis, suggesting its involvement in the fibrotic process.
ACTA2 is expressed in HAFs and its expression is increased in response to Ang-II treatment, which is related to atrial fibrosis.
ACTA2 is an actin protein that is a component of the cytoskeleton.
ACTA2 expression is increased in HAFs in response to miR-23b-3p and miR-27b-3p, which promote atrial fibrosis.

go_data.term: transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway
go_data.justification: Smad1 inactivation and Smad3 activation mediate the pro-fibrotic effects of miR-23b-3p, miR-27b-3p and TGFBR3 siRNA in atrial fibrosis.

Phosphorylated Smad1 (p-Smad1) was decreased, but no direct information about Smad1 location is provided, however Smad3 accumulated in the nuclei of HAFs, and given the context, Smad1 is likely to be in the nucleus as well.
The activation of Smad1 through TGFBR3 and the negative modulation between p-Smad1 and p-Smad3 were in agreement with the previous report.
Phosphorylated Smad1 (p-Smad1) was decreased.
Smad3 activation modulates miR-23b-3p and miR-27b-3p expression.
Smad3 signalling pathway was activated in Ang-II-treated HAFs to promote atrial fibrosis.
Smad3 accumulated in the nuclei of HAFs after transfection with miR-23b-3p, miR-27b-3p and TGFBR3 siRNA.
Smad3 activation modulates miR-23b-3p and miR-27b-3p expression through the Smad3 signalling pathway.
The phosphorylation level of Smad3 was significantly increased in HAFs at 10 minutes in response to Ang-II treatment.
miR-21 is involved in a variety of biological processes and diseases by inhibiting the protein translation process of the target gene.
miR-21 is involved in multiple pro-fibrotic pathways by targeting Spry1, PIAS3, Smad7, and Jagged1.
miR-21 participates in the development of atrial fibrillation through fibrosis-related target genes.
miR-21 inhibits the protein translation process of the target gene.
TRPC3 is targeted by miR-26 to increase Ca2+ entry.
TRPC3 targeting by miR-26 leads to activation of proliferation of fibroblasts.
KCNJ2 is targeted by miR-26 to enhance atrial fibroblast proliferation, suggesting a role in atrial muscle cell differentiation.
KCNJ2 is involved in enhancing I K1, indicating a role in potassium channel activity.
I K1 enhancement is associated with proliferation and differentiation of atrial fibroblasts.
I K1 is associated with potassium ion transport.
Inhibition of miR-23b could alleviate cardiac fibrosis by targeting TGIF1 and PTEN.
MiR-23b-3p could enhance the expression of fibrosis-related genes including COL1A1, COL3A1 and ACTA2.
MiR-23b targets TGIF1 and PTEN to activate TGF-beta1/Smad2/3 signalling and AKT/N-Cadherin signalling.

go_data.term: negative regulation of TGF-beta signaling pathway
go_data.justification: TGIF1 is targeted by miR-23b to activate TGF-beta1/Smad2/3 signalling.
Inhibition of miR-23b could alleviate cardiac fibrosis by targeting TGIF1 to activate TGF-beta1/Smad2/3 signalling in cardiac fibroblasts.

go_data.term: negative regulation of protein kinase B signaling
go_data.justification: PTEN is targeted by miR-23b to activate AKT/N-Cadherin signalling in cardiac fibroblasts.

go_data.term: transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway
go_data.justification: TGF-beta1 is involved in the TGF-beta1/Smad2/3 signalling pathway.
Ang-II can stimulate NADPH oxidases 2 (Nox2) activity through the TGF-beta1 pathway.
TGF-beta1 plays an important role in atrial fibrosis-associated with the heart failure models of AF.
TGF-beta1 is a secreted protein that signals through cell surface receptors.
TGF-beta1 is a growth factor that regulates cell growth and differentiation.
AKT is involved in AKT/N-Cadherin signalling in cardiac fibroblasts.
AKT is a protein kinase.
N-Cadherin is involved in AKT/N-Cadherin signalling.
N-Cadherin is involved in cell adhesion processes.
N-Cadherin is involved in cell-cell adhesion, which occurs at cell junctions.
miR-27b targets PPAR-gamma, ALK5, and other genes to regulate their expression.
miR-27b contributes to cardiac dysfunction with enhanced myocardial fibrosis and attenuated angiotensin II-induced atrial fibrosis.
miR-27b targets specific genes, such as TGIF1, PTEN, and PPAR-gamma, to regulate their expression.
miR-27b is a microRNA, which is typically located in the cytoplasm.
Atrial overexpression of microRNA-27b attenuates angiotensin II-induced atrial fibrosis
Overexpression of miR-27b in cardiomyocytes contributes to cardiac dysfunction with enhanced myocardial fibrosis, and angiotensin II is mentioned in the context of this process
Angiotensin II is known to have effects on blood vessels, although this is not explicitly stated in the text, it is implied through its involvement in fibrosis

go_data.term: transforming growth factor beta-activated receptor activity
go_data.justification: TGFBR1 forms a complex with TGFBR2 to mediate TGF-beta superfamily ligand-dependent signalling.

go_data.term: cellular response to transforming growth factor beta stimulus
go_data.justification: TGFBR1 is involved in TGF-beta1-dependent signalling pathway.
TGFBR1 forms a complex with TGFBR2.

go_data.term: transforming growth factor beta-activated receptor activity
go_data.justification: TGFBR2 is mentioned in the context of TGF-beta1 receptor complex formation.
TGFBR2 is part of the TGF-beta signaling pathway, which is a cell surface receptor signaling pathway.
As a receptor, TGFBR2 is expected to be located in the plasma membrane.
FN1 mRNA expression is up-regulated in atrial appendages of AF patients, suggesting a role in fibrosis.
Not explicitly stated in the text, however FN1 is known to bind fibrinogen.
FN1 is a component of the extracellular matrix.
IL-1beta is described as an inflammation-related gene that is significantly up-regulated in atrial appendages of AF patients.
IL-1beta is implied to have cytokine activity as it is mentioned alongside other inflammatory factors.
CRP is mentioned alongside other inflammation-related genes, such as IL-1beta, which are significantly up-regulated in atrial appendages of AF patients.
CRP is described as an inflammatory factor, with its obvious increase found in atrial appendage tissue of AF patients.
TNF-alpha is mentioned alongside other inflammation-related genes, such as IL-1beta and CRP.
ACE1 is known for its role in converting angiotensin I to angiotensin II, a function that involves peptidyl-dipeptidase activity.
ACE1 is associated with the renin-angiotensin-aldosterone system (RAAS), which plays a crucial role in regulating blood pressure and is primarily located in blood vessels.
ACE2 is part of the RAAS system, which is involved in blood pressure regulation.
ACE2 is known to have peptidyl-dipeptidase activity, although not explicitly stated in the given text, it is a well-known function of the ACE2 gene.
Apelin is associated with RAAS (Renin-Angiotensin-Aldosterone System), which plays a crucial role in regulating blood pressure.
No significant changes of RAAS-associated genes, such as ACE1, ACE2 and Apelin were observed in the atrial appendages of AF patients.

go_data.justification: Inhibition of TGF-beta1 blunts reactive oxygen species (ROS) formation.

go_data.term: transforming growth factor beta receptor activity
go_data.justification: Acvrl1 is part of the Acvrl1/Smad1 axis, which is involved in TGF-beta signaling.
Acvrl1 is part of the Acvrl1/Smad1 axis, which is active in lung fibroblasts and antagonizes Tgfbr1/Smad2/3 signalling.
